comment.author: 76204898@N00
comment._content: James Watson Gerard (August 25, 1867 - September 6, 1951). Under President Woodrow Wilson, he served as the American Ambassador to Germany from 1913 to 1917. The German government asked him to leave in January of 1917. Oddly enough, I researched Fanny zu Reventlow a couple of days ago and in the process discovered her Nazi brother Ernst who, according to the Wikipedia article, "accused United States Ambassador Gerard of being a British spy".

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks trialsanderrors, we'll fill in more of this information the next time we update the record.
